table.name: affiliation
table.remarks: Affiliations of people to institutions. A person may be associated with more than one institution.

column.name: affiliation_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID for each affiliation. Generated by database

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for a person. Links to person table.

column.name: institution_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for an institution. Links to institution table

column.name: email
column.remarks: Email address of the person

column.name: address
column.remarks: Street address of the person

column.name: person_url
column.remarks: Link to webpage of the person

column.name: start_date
column.remarks: Date the person became affiliated with the institution

column.name: end_date
column.remarks: Date the person left the institution

column.name: is_current
column.remarks: Whether affiliation is current. Person can have multiple affiliations over time. Note: collaborators view is populated where is_current is true.

table.name: alternate_num
table.remarks: Alternate original sample numbers. The same samples are frequently numbered/named in different ways in different publications and institutional collections. A sample may be associated with more than one alternate number.

column.name: sample_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for a sample, links to the sample table. Part of a composite primary key in this table, along with alternate_num.

column.name: alternate_num
column.remarks: PK/FK. Alternate sample number/name. Part of a composite primary key in this table along with sample_id. Note that alternate_num is not always unique

column.name: reference_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the reference work, for cases where the alternate_num appears in a publication. Links to the reference_work table.

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Any notes about the alternate_num. Include information about the source of the alternate number, especially if it is not published.

table.name: analysis
table.remarks: Analysis details for a batch i.e. preparation, experimental and analytical methods, who ran the analysis and/or provided the data

column.name: analysis_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID for each analysis record for each batch. Generated by database.

column.name: prep_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for each preparation method e.g. Tungsten carbide shatterbox. Links to the dic_prep_method table.

column.name: exp_method_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for each experimental method used e.g. Treated with HCl. Links to the dic_exp_method table.

column.name: ana_method_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for each analytical method used e.g. ICP:MS. Links to the dic_ana_method table.

column.name: batch_id
column.remarks: FK. Identifier for the batch. Links to the batch table

column.name: analysis_notes
column.remarks: Detailed description of the analysis. Often cut-and-paste from the methods section for published data.

column.name: lab_method_code
column.remarks: Laboratory-specific code for the analysis, usually from a commercial lab e.g. MA200 from Bureau Veritas

column.name: run_by
column.remarks: FK. The person who ran the experiment (note: sample preparation may have been done by someone else). Links to person table.

column.name: provided_by
column.remarks: The person who provided the data - they may or may not have run the analysis themselves. Primarily used to track the provenance of unpublished results. Links to person table.

table.name: analysis_instrument
table.remarks: Linking instruments to analysis

table.name: analyte_determination_limits
table.remarks: Detection limits (lower and upper) and analytes for each analysis.

column.name: limit_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID for each record describing the analyte determination limits for a each analyte in a batch. Generated by the database

column.name: analysis_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for each analysis record. Links to analysis table.

column.name: detection_lower_limit
column.remarks: From BGS: This column contains for each analyte the LOWEST level that can be reliably detected using the specified combination of laboratory, analysis method, sample preparation technique.

column.name: detection_upper_limit
column.remarks: From BGS: This column contains for each analyte the MAXIMUM level that can be reliably detected using the specified combination of laboratory, analysis method, sample preparation technique.

table.name: author
table.remarks: Links reference_work to person (authors)

column.name: author_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID for each author. Generated by the database

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for each author. Links to the person table.

column.name: reference_id
column.remarks: FK. ID of the reference_work. Links to the reference_work table.

column.name: author_position
column.remarks: Records the position of each author

table.name: basin
table.remarks: Information about the basin, prefereably including a basin name (e.g. Taconic Foreland Basin), and a basin type (from dic_basin).

column.name: basin_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID for a basin. Generated by the database.

column.name: basin_type_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the basin type. Links to dic_basin_type table.

column.name: basin_name
column.remarks: Name for the basin eg. McArthur Basin

column.name: basin_notes
column.remarks: Notes about the basin

table.name: batch
table.remarks: A batch of samples analysed at the same laboratory at roughly the same time. One batch of samples may go through multiple analyses, and samples may be associated with mutiple batches (see batch_sample table)

column.name: batch_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID for a batch. Generated by the database.

column.name: lab_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the laboratory where the analysis was undertaken. Links to the institution table.

column.name: lab_batch_id
column.remarks: The batch number issued by an analytical laboratory to identify the batch of samples, this will almost certainly be unique for each laboratory but may not be globally unique.

column.name: end_date
column.remarks: Date of registration of the batch.

column.name: batch_notes
column.remarks: Brief description of the batch

table.name: batch_sample
table.remarks: Linking table to record which samples were batched together

column.name: batch_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for a batch. Links to the batch table. Part of composite primary key.

column.name: sample_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for the sample. Links to the sample table. Part of composite primary key.

table.name: biostrat
table.remarks: Biostratigraphical details

column.name: biostrat_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID for a biostratigraphic designation. Generated by the database.

column.name: verbatim_biostrat
column.remarks: Verbatim biostratigraphy, provided by the author or from published work. May include abbreviations, or names which are not formal biozones, which nevertheless provide useful information

table.name: collecting_event
table.remarks: Details of sample collection from a particular site, in particular the date of collection. A site can be revisted multiple times.

column.name: coll_event_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID for a collecting event. Generated by the database

column.name: site_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for a site. Links to the site table

column.name: start_date_verbatim
column.remarks: Start of the collection event.

column.name: end_date_verbatim
column.remarks: End of the collection event

column.name: coll_event_notes
column.remarks: Notes about the event.

table.name: collector
table.remarks: Linking table recording the people who were involved in the collecting event

column.name: collector_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID. Generated by the database

column.name: coll_event_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the collecting event. Links to the collecting_event table.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the collector. Links to the person table.

table.name: craton_terrane
table.remarks: Name and type of either craton (e.g. Laurentia) or terrane (e.g. Avalonia).

column.name: craton_terrane_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID. Generated by the database

column.name: ct_name
column.remarks: Name of the craton or terrane e.g. Laurentia

table.name: data_source
table.remarks: Data sources - large scale separation between, for example, external databases and SGP data (e.g. USGS, CMIBS, SGP)

column.name: data_source
column.remarks: Name of the data source: SGP, USGS-NGDB, USGS-CMIBS

table.name: data_source_batch
table.remarks: Linking table to record which batches of data belong to which data_source

column.name: data_source_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for the sample. Links to the sample table. Part of composite primary key.

column.name: batch_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for the batch. Links to the batch table. Part of composite primary key.

table.name: dic_ana_method
table.remarks: Dictionary of analytical methods

column.name: ana_method_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID. Generated by the database.

column.name: ana_method_code
column.remarks: Code for analytical method e.g. XRF, ICP:MS etc. Based in part on the list used by EarthChem

column.name: ana_method_translation
column.remarks: General description of the method

column.name: ana_method_desc
column.remarks: Detailed description of the method

column.name: reference_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the reference_work. Links to reference_work table.

table.name: dic_analyte
table.remarks: Dictionary of chemical analytes

column.name: analyte_code
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier for each geochemical analyte. Chemical symbol or accepted code e.g. FeT, Fe-carb, 34S-CAS etc.

column.name: analyte_translation
column.remarks: Short description of the analyte e.g. Iron, Carbonate-associated iron etc.

column.name: analyte_desc
column.remarks: Longer description of the analyte e.g. Carbonate-associated iron (e.g. iron in siderite, iron in ankerite), extracted as the first step in a sequential extraction (method SeqA)

column.name: atomic_num
column.remarks: Atomic number for those analytes that are chemical elements

column.name: weight
column.remarks: Atomic weight

table.name: dic_basin_type
table.remarks: Dictionary of basin types

column.name: basin_type_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by the database

column.name: basin_type
column.remarks: Basin type, e.g. rift, peripheral foreland etc.

table.name: dic_biostrat
table.remarks: Dictionary of biozones. Not often used - verbatim biostrat is stored in biostrat.

column.name: biozone_name
column.remarks: Name of the biozone

column.name: biozone_fossil_type
column.remarks: Type of organism used to define the zone - graptolite, trilobite etc.

table.name: dic_color
table.remarks: Dictionary of colors, with and without Munsell codes, separated into name, qualifier, shade

column.name: color_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID. Generated by the database

column.name: color_name
column.remarks: Basic color name

column.name: color_qualifier
column.remarks: Color qualifier e.g. greyish, yellowish, greenish etc.

column.name: color_shade
column.remarks: Color shale e.g. dark, pale, medium dark etc.

table.name: dic_continent
table.remarks: Dictionary of contintents and oceans

column.name: iso_code
column.remarks: ISO Continent code, or CIA code for oceans

table.name: dic_country
table.remarks: Dictionary of countries and seas

column.name: iso_code
column.remarks: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)

column.name: country
column.remarks: English country name

column.name: full_name
column.remarks: Full English country name

column.name: iso3
column.remarks: Three-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-3)

column.name: iso_number
column.remarks: Three-digit country number (ISO 3166-1 numeric)

table.name: dic_env_detail
table.remarks: Dictionary of detailed depositional environments. Added in 2021

column.name: env_detail_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by the database

column.name: env_detail
column.remarks: Depositional environment

column.name: env_detail_type
column.remarks: Depositional environment category - carbonate, siliciclastic, lacustrine etc

column.name: env_detail_full
column.remarks: Concatenation of env_detail and env_detail_type, used in dropdown lists on excel template

table.name: dic_exp_method
table.remarks: Dictionary of experimental methods

column.name: exp_method_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by the database

column.name: exp_method_code
column.remarks: Code for the experimental method e.g. CRS

column.name: exp_method_translation
column.remarks: General description of the method

column.name: exp_method_desc
column.remarks: Detailed description of the method

column.name: reference_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the reference work for the method. Links to the reference_work table.

table.name: dic_ics_age
table.remarks: Dictionary of International Commission on Stratigraphy, International Chronostratigraphic timescale. See http://www.stratigraphy.org Version: 2022/10.

column.name: ics_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by database

column.name: ics_name
column.remarks: Name of the time period

column.name: earliest_age
column.remarks: Earliest age

column.name: latest_age
column.remarks: Latest age

column.name: ics_parent_id
column.remarks: Parent id, refers to the ics_id column

column.name: ics_level
column.remarks: Level of age unit 1=Eonothem, 2=Erathem, 3=System, 4=Series, 5=Stage

table.name: dic_institution_type
table.remarks: Dictionary of institution types, from ODM2 (http://odm2.github.io/ODM2/schemas/ODM2_Current/index.html) with additions

column.name: institution_type
column.remarks: Type of institution

column.name: institution_type_desc
column.remarks: Description of the institution type

table.name: dic_instrument
table.remarks: Dictionary of analytical instruments

column.name: instrument_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique ID. Generated by the database.

column.name: instrument_name
column.remarks: Name of the instrument

column.name: company
column.remarks: The company that manufactures the instrument. Note that company names change through time, and mergers are common - this column may not accurately reflect the name of the company at the time of manufacture

column.name: instrument_type
column.remarks: Type of instrument

table.name: dic_lith_composition
table.remarks: Dictionary of terms to describe the composition of samples e.g. calcareous, siliceous, carbonaceous. Based on table from Potter et al. 2005 Mud and Mudstones

column.name: lith_composition_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by database

column.name: lith_composition
column.remarks: Compositional term, e.g. calcareous, siliceous

column.name: lith_composition_desc
column.remarks: Description/definition of compositonal term

table.name: dic_lith_texture
table.remarks: Dictionary of terms to describe the lithological texture of samples e.g. silty, muddy, clayey, sandy. Based on table from Potter et al. 2005 Mud and Mudstones

column.name: lith_texture_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by database

column.name: lith_texture
column.remarks: Textural term, e.g. silty, sandy

column.name: lith_texture_desc
column.remarks: Description/definition of textural term

table.name: dic_lithology
table.remarks: Dictionary table of lithological terms, based in part on Macrostrat

column.name: lith_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by database

column.name: lith_name
column.remarks: Lithological name e.g. shale, mudstone

column.name: lith_type
column.remarks: Lithological type e.g. siliciclastic, carbonate, chemical

column.name: lith_class
column.remarks: Lithological class e.g. sedimentary, metamorphic

table.name: dic_lithostrat
table.remarks: Dictionary of lithostratigraphic names, populated from Macrostrat (in Nov 2015, up to lithostrat_id 80624), with subsequent additions in the same format. Includes BGS, GSC, and ASUD identifiers.

table.name: dic_meta
table.remarks: Dictionary of low-temperature metamorphic bins, based roughly on metapelite zones

column.name: meta_name
column.remarks: Name of the bin, primarily low-temp, low-grade - Diagenetic zone, Epizone, Anchizone.

column.name: meta_desc
column.remarks: General description of the bin

column.name: maturity
column.remarks: Thermal maturity in context of organic matter and hydrocarbon production

column.name: biomarkers
column.remarks: Whether biomarkers are preserved

column.name: ro
column.remarks: Vitrinite reflectance. From AAPG: percentage of incident light reflected from the surface of vitrinite particles in a sedimentary rock.

column.name: facies
column.remarks: Metamorphic facies

column.name: grade
column.remarks: Metamorphic grade

table.name: dic_prep_method
table.remarks: Dictionary of sample preparation methods

column.name: prep_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by the database

column.name: prep_translation
column.remarks: General description of the method

column.name: prep_desc
column.remarks: Detailed description of the method

table.name: dic_project_type
table.remarks: Dictionary of project types.

column.name: project_type
column.remarks: Type of project

column.name: project_desc
column.remarks: Description of project type

table.name: dic_proxy
table.remarks: Dictionary of geochemical proxies (e.g. FeHR/FeT)

column.name: proxy_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by the database

column.name: proxy
column.remarks: Proxy abbreviation or code (e.g. FeHR/FeT, FePR, Ni/Co etc.)

column.name: proxy_desc
column.remarks: Longer description or breakdown of proxy

column.name: proxy_notes
column.remarks: Notes about the proxy (e.g. updated method for determining highly-reactive to total iron)

column.name: reference_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the publication which originally described the proxy. Links to reference_work table

table.name: dic_publication
table.remarks: Dictionary of publications - mostly scientific journals.

column.name: publication_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by database

column.name: publication_name
column.remarks: Name of the journal/publication

column.name: publication_abbreviation
column.remarks: Abbreviation of the journal name

column.name: publisher_name
column.remarks: Publisher name

column.name: publisher_location
column.remarks: Place of publication

column.name: issn
column.remarks: International Standard Serial Number

table.name: dic_sed_structure
table.remarks: Dictionary of sedimentary structures

column.name: sed_structure_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier of the sedimentary structure. Generated by database.

column.name: sed_structure_name
column.remarks: Name of the sedimentary structure

table.name: dic_weathering
table.remarks: Dictionary of weathering terms from the International Society for Rock Mechanics (and others)

column.name: weath_grade
column.remarks: PK. Numbered gradation, with I being the least weathered and VI the most weathered

column.name: weath_term
column.remarks: Short descriptive term of weathering grade

column.name: weath_desc
column.remarks: Descriptive definition of weathering grades

table.name: environment
table.remarks: Depositional environment details - primarily concerned with water depth, also records whether or not sediments are turbidites

column.name: env_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier for reported environment. Generated by database

column.name: env_notes
column.remarks: Notes about the depositional environment.

column.name: is_turbiditic
column.remarks: Whether the environment was turbiditic.

column.name: temp_deg_c
column.remarks: Temperature in celcius, applies to modern environments where water temperature was directly measured.

column.name: verbatim_env
column.remarks: Verbatim depositional environment.

column.name: env_bin
column.remarks: Environmental bin: Inner Shelf (1), Outer Shelf (2) and Basinal (3), Lacustrine (4), Fluvial (5). See Sperling et al. 2015 for description.

table.name: fossil
table.remarks: Fossil names and Paleobiology Database code. Note verbatim fossil information from context sheets is reported on the fossil_sample table, and may not be linked to formal fossil name until later date.

column.name: fossil_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by database

column.name: fossil_name
column.remarks: Fossil name - genus and species if possible, higher level taxonomy if not.

column.name: pbdb_code
column.remarks: Paleobiological Database identifier

column.name: fossil_notes
column.remarks: Notes e.g. no PBDB identifier available

table.name: fossil_sample
table.remarks: Table linking samples to fossils, and recording the verbatim fossil name

column.name: sample_id
column.remarks: FK. ID of the sample. Links to the sample table.

column.name: fossil_id
column.remarks: FK. ID of the fossil. Links to the fossil table.

column.name: verbatim_fossil
column.remarks: Verbatim fossil name

table.name: framboid
table.remarks: Pyrite framboid data, very rarely used

column.name: framboid_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by database

column.name: num_framboids
column.remarks: Number of framboids measured per sample

column.name: min_diameter_micron
column.remarks: Minimum framboid diameter in microns

column.name: max_diameter_micron
column.remarks: Maximum framboid diameter in microns

column.name: avg_diameter_micron
column.remarks: Average framboid diameter in microns

column.name: std_dev
column.remarks: Standard deviation of framboid size

column.name: density_per_mm2
column.remarks: Density of framboids per mm2

column.name: sample_id
column.remarks: FK. References sample table

table.name: geol_age
table.remarks: Geological age - verbatim and International Commission on Stratigraphy (ICS) age

column.name: age_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier for the reported age. Generated by database

column.name: ics_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the formal ICS age. Links to the dic_ics_age table, a dictionary of International Commission on Stratigraphy age names.

column.name: verbatim_age
column.remarks: Verbatim age as reported in publication, or by contributors.

column.name: age_notes
column.remarks: Notes about how the age was determined.

column.name: age_modifier
column.remarks: Upper, middle,lower - where not part of the official ICS name.

table.name: geol_context
table.remarks: Links lithostratigraphy, biostratigraphy, depositional environment and age data. Multiple samples from related site/project/paper often have the same combination of these four factors, and may use one geol_context_id.

column.name: geol_context_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier. Generated by database

column.name: env_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the environment. Links to the environment table.

column.name: age_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the geological age. Links to the geol_age table.

column.name: lithostrat_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the lithostratigraphy. Links to the lithostrat table

column.name: biostrat_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the biostratigraphy. Links to the biostrat table.

table.name: geol_context_provided_by
table.remarks: Linking table between geological context and person - more than one person can contribute to the geological context

column.name: geol_context_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for the geological context. Links to the geol_context table. Part of composite primary key.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for person who provided the details of the geological context. Links to the person table. Part of composite primary key.

table.name: interpreted_age
table.remarks: The interpreted age of the sample in millions of years, with justification.

column.name: interpreted_age
column.remarks: Interpreted age in Ma

column.name: interpreted_age_notes
column.remarks: Justification for assigned interpreted age

column.name: sample_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the sample. Links to the sample table.

table.name: interpreted_age_provided_by
table.remarks: Linking table between interpreted_age and person - more than one person can contribute to the interpreted_age

column.name: interpreted_age_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for the interpreted_age. Links to the interpreted_age table. Part of composite primary key.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for the person who provided the interpreted age. Links to the person table. Part of composite primary key.

table.name: lithostrat
table.remarks: Reported geological unit (e.g. group, formation or member) - verbatim and with reference to dic_lithostrat

column.name: strat_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the formal lithostratigraphical name. Links to the dic_lithostrat table.

column.name: lithostrat_desc
column.remarks: General lithological description of the unit.

column.name: verbatim_strat
column.remarks: Verbatim lithostratigraphy e.g. upper middle Frankfort Shale.

column.name: lithostrat_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier for the described geological unit. Generated by database.

table.name: person
table.remarks: A list of people - can be contributors, authors, collectors etc.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier for a person. Generated by database.

column.name: first_name
column.remarks: First name.

column.name: middle_initial
column.remarks: Middle initial (with period).

column.name: last_name
column.remarks: Last name.

column.name: orcid
column.remarks: ORCID - See https://orcid.org/

table.name: project
table.remarks: Project is a way to link samples together. Each reference work is one project, other kinds of project include e.g. student summer projects, dissertations, field seasons, groups of related reference works etc.

column.name: project_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier for a project. Generated by database.

column.name: project_name
column.remarks: Name of the project.

column.name: project_type
column.remarks: Type of project - e.g. PhD, Published Paper, Summer Project, Lab Project

column.name: start_date
column.remarks: Start date, ISO format. Often not available, usually only used for lab projects

column.name: end_date
column.remarks: End date, ISO format. For a reference work, the date of publication/date available online is used.

column.name: is_public
column.remarks: Whether the project data can be made public (false by default).

column.name: project_desc
column.remarks: Description of the project.

table.name: project_citation
table.remarks: Linking table for projects and reference works

column.name: project_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID of the project. Links to the project table. Part of composite primary key.

column.name: reference_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID of the reference work. Links to reference_work table. Part of composite primary key.

table.name: project_sample
table.remarks: Links projects with samples.

column.name: project_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID of the project. Links to the project table.

column.name: sample_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID of the sample. Links to the sample table

table.name: proxy_published
table.remarks: Published "proxy" results - results that are calculated using original measured data.

column.name: proxy_pub_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier for published proxy. Generated by database.

column.name: proxy_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the proxy. Links to the dic_proxy table.

column.name: proxy_pub_value
column.remarks: Published proxy value.

column.name: sample_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the sample. Links to the sample table.

column.name: proxy_pub_notes
column.remarks: Notes directly relevent to the proxy or the published value

column.name: reference_id
column.remarks: FK. Identifier for the reference work where the proxy was published.

column.name: citation_notes
column.remarks: Notes relevant to the reference work where the proxy was published, e.g. Published in Canfield et al. 2008 only, although original data is from Canfield et al. 2007.

table.name: reference_work
table.remarks: Reference work, may be published or unpublished.

column.name: reference_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier for reference work. Generated by database.

column.name: is_published
column.remarks: Notes if reference work has been published.

column.name: pub_year
column.remarks: Year of publication.

column.name: title
column.remarks: Title of reference work.

column.name: pages
column.remarks: Page numbers of reference work.

column.name: volume
column.remarks: Volume number of reference work.

column.name: reference_type
column.remarks: Type of reference work e.g. Journal article, PhD Dissertation.

column.name: url
column.remarks: Link to reference work.

column.name: doi
column.remarks: Digital object identifier.

column.name: book_title
column.remarks: Title of book.

column.name: journal_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the journal. Links to the dic_journal table.

table.name: sample_provided_by
table.remarks: Linking table between sample and person - more than one person can contribute to the description of the sample

column.name: sample_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for the sample. Links to the sample table. Part of composite primary key.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for the person who provided the details of the sample (e.g. lithology, color). Links to the sample table. Part of composite primary key.

table.name: sed_structure_sample
table.remarks: Linking table for samples and sedimentary structures

column.name: sample_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for the sample. Links to the sample table. Part of composite primary key

column.name: sed_structure_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. ID for the sedimentary structure. Links to the sed_structure table. Part of composite primary key

table.name: storage
table.remarks: Where the samples are stored

column.name: storage_id
column.remarks: PK. Unique identifier for each storage location. Generated by database.

column.name: institution_id
column.remarks: FK. ID for the institution where the sample is stored. Links to the institution table.

column.name: building
column.remarks: Building where the sample is stored.

column.name: room
column.remarks: Room where the sample is stored.

column.name: cabinet
column.remarks: Cabinet where the sample is stored.

column.name: shelf_drawer
column.remarks: Shelf or drawer where sample is stored.
